description:
'default' security group should be deleted by admin only

After the release of review (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22713/)  a 'default' security group can be deleted by any user. But this functionality should only stay with admin and he should have the privelege to delete a 'default' security group if it is required.

Expected Error : ERROR (BadRequest): Removing default security group not allowed. (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: )


Version – Stable Juno
Ubuntu – 14.04
title: 'default' security group should be deleted by admin only

comments.content:
'default' security group should be deleted by admin only

After the release of review (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22713/)  a 'default' security group can be deleted by any user. But this functionality should only stay with admin and he should have the privelege to delete a 'default' security group if it is required.

Expected Error : ERROR (BadRequest): Removing default security group not allowed. (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: )


Version – Stable Juno
Ubuntu – 14.04
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~abhishek-talwar

comments.content:
As far as I can see, only admin can delete the 'default' security group, and that it what is added by the linked patch.

ubuntu@comp:~/devstack$ . openrc

ubuntu@comp:~/devstack$ nova secgroup-delete default
ERROR (BadRequest): Removing default security group not allowed. (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-208b1911-99f6-411f-8429-e05051e71cba)

ubuntu@comp:~/devstack$ . openrc admin

ubuntu@comp:~/devstack$ nova secgroup-delete default
+--------------------------------------+---------+------------------------+
| Id                                   | Name    | Description            |
+--------------------------------------+---------+------------------------+
| 807b81e4-5e48-455d-ac19-5c4f9ea37bda | default | Default security group |
+--------------------------------------+---------+------------------------+
ubuntu@comp:~/devstack$
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~matthew-gilliard-u

comments.content: Can you provide more detail please?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~matthew-gilliard-u

comments.content:
Hi Mathew,

My Bug Discuuses about this feature.

When you create a new project, add a user to it, and boot a vm for that tenant, by default,
nova adds the tenant's vm to the default security group.

#keystone tenant-create --name foo
#keystone user-role-add --user admin --role Member --tenant foo
#OS_TENANT_NAME=foo nova boot --image cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec --flavor m1.tiny foo_vm

#nova secgroup-list --all-tenants
+----+---------+-------------+----------------------------------+
| Id | Name | Description | Tenant_ID |
+----+---------+-------------+----------------------------------+
| 2 | default | default | 1a1878b5d05648a3970c6c0c2a648a0b |
| 1 | default | default | 9b84a2926f5b4df091774afc1ad7e1f3 |
+----+---------+-------------+----------------------------------+

The issue is that if I want to delete the security group related to my tenant I can't


Thanks and Regards
Abhishek Talwar
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~abhishek-talwar

comments.content:
Moreover, the message "  Removing default security group not allowed. (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-208b1911-99f6-411f-8429-e05051e71cba) " is not clear. As it does not tell the user that why is he not allowed to remove the defaulty security group.
So I wanted to discuss that can we also modify the error message to something that tells the user that he does not have the priveleged rights to remove the sefault security group. This way the user will not be confused as why is he not allowed.

Thanks and Regards
Abhishek Talwar
